title: Tell HN: John Friel my father, internet pioneer and creator of QModem, has died
author: AaronFriel
aiHeadline: RIP John Friel, the internet pioneer who brought us QModem, because who doesn't love a good blast from the past, and his son AaronFriel is probably feeling pretty nostalgic right about now, so let's all take a moment to appreciate the dude who helped us get online back in the dark ages of dial-up

title: AI companies cause most of traffic on forums
author: ta988
aiHeadline: Breaking news: AI companies are apparently responsible for most of the traffic on forums, which is just perfect because what's more fun than reading about how AI is taking over the world, one comment section at a time, according to some genius who goes by the name of ta988

author: cookiengineer
aiHeadline: From Pegasus to Predator, it seems like commercial spyware on iOS has evolved from a pesky little bug to a full-blown, James-Bond-villain-esque monster, so thanks for the update, cookiengineer, now we can all rest easy knowing our iPhones are being spied on by highly advanced, super-sophisticated spyware

title: Curl-Impersonate
author: jakeogh
aiHeadline: Introducing Curl-Impersonate, because who doesn't love a good game of dress-up, especially when it comes to curl commands, and thanks to jakeogh for bringing this super-exciting, not-at-all-confusing tool to our attention, because what's more thrilling than impersonating a curl command

title: 'Obelisks': New Class of Life Has Been Found in Human Digestive System
author: unkeen
aiHeadline: Scientists have discovered an entirely new class of life, dubbed 'Obelisks', living in the human digestive system, because what's more fun than finding out you've got a bunch of mysterious, ancient structures hanging out in your gut, and thanks to unkeen for sharing this totally-not-terrifying news with us, so let's all take a moment to appreciate the tiny, obelisk-shaped overlords living inside us
